original: Pacchātāpā’nubandhesu, rāgādo’nusayo bhave;
analyzed: pacchā tāpa anubandhesu rāga ādi anusayaḥ bhave
translated: In the regrets, in the consequences, in the passion, etc., the underlying tendency is in the existence;

original: Mātaṅgamuddhapiṇḍe tu, ghaṭe kumbho dasambaṇe.
analyzed: tu ghaṭe kumbhaḥ
translated: In the Mātaṅga, in the Uddhapindaka, in the pot, the water-pot, in the ten parts.

original: Parivāro parijane, khaggakose paricchade;
analyzed: parivāraḥ parijane khagga kose paricchade
translated: The retinue, in the attendants, in the sword-case, in the covering,

original: Ālambaro tu sārambhe, bheribhede ca dissati.
analyzed: ālambaraḥ tu sa ārambhe bheri bhede ca dissati
translated: But ālambara is found in sārambha, and in bheribheda.

original: Khaṇo kālavisese ca, nibyāpāraṭṭhitimhi ca;
analyzed: khaṇaḥ kāla visese ca nibyāpāra ṭṭhitimhi ca
translated: Khaṇa is in a particular time, and in nibyāpāraṭṭhitimhi;

original: Kule tva’bhijano vutto, uppattibhūmiyampi ca.
analyzed: kule tu abhijanaḥ vuttaḥ uppatti bhūmiyam pi ca
translated: Kula is said in abhijana, and in the place of origin.

original: Āhāro kabaḷīkārā, hārādīsu ca kāraṇe;
analyzed: āhāraḥ kabaḷīkārāḥ hāra ādīsu ca kāraṇe
translated: Āhāra is in kabaḷīkārā, and in the reasons beginning with hārā;

original: Vissāse yācanāyañca, peme ca paṇayo mato.
analyzed: vissāse peme ca paṇayaḥ mato
translated: Vissāsa is in yācanā, and in peme, and paṇaya is considered.

original: Ṇādo saddhā, cīvarādi, hetvā’dhāresu paccayo;
analyzed: ṇa ādaḥ saddhā cīvara ādi hetvādhāresu paccayaḥ
translated: Ṇāda is in saddhā, and cīvara, etc., are conditions in hetvā’dhāra;

original: Kīḷā dibbavihārādo, vihāro sugatālaye.
analyzed: vihāro sugata ālaye
translated: Kīḷā is in dibbavihārā, and vihāra is in the abode of the Sugata.

original: Samatthane mato citte, kaggatāyaṃ samādhi ca;
analyzed: citte ca
translated: Samatthāna is considered in citta, and samādhi is in kaggatāyaṃ;

original: Yogo saṅgati saṅge ca (ṭī.) kāmādo,
analyzed: yogaḥ saṅge ca ṭī kāma ādaḥ
translated: Yoga is in saṅgati, and in saṅga, and in kāmādo;

original: Jhāno’pāyesu yuttiyaṃ.
analyzed: jhāna upāyesu yuttiyam
translated: Jhāna is in apāyesu, and in yutti.

original: Bhogo sappaphaṇa’ṅgesu, koṭille bhuñjane dhane;
analyzed: bhogaḥ sappa phaṇaṅgesu koṭille bhuñjane dhane
translated: Bhoga is in sappaphaṇa’ṅgesu, and in koṭille, and in bhuñjane, and in dhana;

original: Bhūmibhāge kilese ca, male cā’ṅgaṇa muccate.
analyzed: bhūmi bhāge kilese ca male muccate
translated: Bhūmibhāga is in kilese, and in male, and in aṅgaṇa it is released.

original: Dhanādidappe paññāya, abhimāno mato tha ca;
analyzed: dhana ādi dappe paññāya abhimānaḥ mataḥ tha ca
translated: Dhanā is in adappe, and in paññā, and abhimāna is considered in tha,

original: Apadeso nimitte ca, chale ca kathane mato.
analyzed: apadesaḥ nimitte ca chale ca kathane mataḥ
translated: Apadesa is in nimitta, and in chala, and kathana is considered.

original: Citte kāye sabhāve ca, so attā parama’ttani;
analyzed: citte kāye sabhāve ca saḥ attā paramattani
translated: Citta is in kāya, and in sabhāva, and so attā is in parama’ttani;

original: Atha gumbo ca thambasmiṃ thambhasmiṃ (ṭī.), samūhe balasajjane.
analyzed: atha gumbo ca thambasmin thambhasmin ṭī samūhe bala sajjane
translated: Then gumbo is in thambasmiṃ, and in samūha, and balasajjana.

original: Antoghare kusūle ca, koṭṭho ntokucchiyaṃ pyatha;🔽Sopānaṅgamhi uṇhīso, makuṭe sīsaveṭhane.
analyzed: antoghare kusūle ca koṭṭhaḥ ntokucchiyam  makuṭe sīsa veṭhane
translated: In the house, in the granary, in the storehouse, in the belly, in the womb,🔽In the staircase, in the head, in the diadem, in the turban on the head.

original: Niyyāse sekhare dvāre, niyyūho nāgadantake;
analyzed: niyyāse sekhare dvāre niyyūhaḥ nāgadantake
translated: In the release, in the neck, in the door, in the release, in the tusk of the elephant,

original: Atho sikhaṇḍe tūṇīre, kalāpo nikare mato.
analyzed: atho sikhaṇḍe tūṇīre kalāpaḥ nikare mataḥ
translated: And in the crest, in the quiver, the bundle is considered as a heap.

original: Cūḷā saṃyatakesesu, makuṭe moḷi ca dvisu;🔽Saṅkho tva’nitthiyaṃ kambu, nalāṭa’ṭṭhīsu lalāṭaṭṭhīsu (sī.) gopphake.
analyzed: cūḍā saṃyata kesesu makuṭe moḷi ca dvisu  saṅkhaḥ tu anitthiyam kambu nalāṭa ṭṭhīsu lalāṭa ṭṭhīsu sī gopphake
translated: In the little hair, in the braids, in the diadem, in the turban, in the two,🔽The shell is a conch, not a woman, the forehead is the bone in the forehead. (Sī.) in the gobbet.

original: Pakkho kāle bale sādhye, sakhī vājesu paṅgule;
analyzed: pakkhaḥ kāle bale sādhye sakhī vājesu paṅgule
translated: In the month, in the time, in the power, in the accomplishment, the friend is in the race, in the lame,

original: Dese’ṇṇave pume sindhu, saritāyaṃ sa nāriyaṃ.
analyzed: pume sindhu saritā ayam sa nāriyam
translated: In the country, in the ocean, in the man, the river is in the woman.

original: Gaje kareṇu purise, so hatthiniya mitthiyaṃ;
analyzed: gaje kareṇu purise so hatthiniya mitthiyam
translated: In the elephant, in the tusker, in the man, the she-elephant is in the woman,

original: Ratane vajiro nitthī, maṇivedhi’ndahetisu.
analyzed: ratane vajiraḥ nitthī maṇi vedhinda hetisu
translated: The jewel is a diamond, not a woman, the gem is in the egg, in the two.

original: Visāṇaṃ tīsu mātaṅga, dante ca pasusiṅgake;
analyzed: visāṇam tīsu mātaṅga dante ca pasusiṅgake
translated: In the three, the deer, the tusk, and in the horn of the cow,

original: Koṭiyaṃ tu mato koṇo, tathā vādittavādane.
analyzed: tu mataḥ koṇo tathā
translated: In the corner, it is considered as the point, and so in the playing of a musical instrument.

original: Vaṇippathe ca nagare, vede ca nigamo tha ca;
analyzed: vaṇippathe ca nagare vede ca nigamaḥ ca
translated: In the path of trade, and in the city, in the Veda, in the village, and in the that,

original: Vivādādo’ dhikaraṇaṃ, siyā’dhāre ca kāraṇe.
analyzed: vivāda ādaḥ adhikaraṇam ca kāraṇe
translated: In the dispute, in the legal question, it may be in the support, and in the reason.

original: Pasumhi vasudhāyañca, vācādo go pumitthiyaṃ;
analyzed: pasumhi vasudhāyan ca vācā adaḥ go pumitthiyam
translated: In the animal, in the earth, in the speech, the cow is in the man, in the woman,

original: Harite tu suvaṇṇe ca, vāsudeve harī’rito.
analyzed: harite tu suvaṇṇe ca vāsudeve hari īritaḥ
translated: But in the Harita and Suvaṇṇa, and in the Vāsudeva, it is called ‘the tawny one’.

original: Āyatte parivāre ca, bhariyāyaṃ pariggaho;
analyzed: āyatte parivāre ca bhariyāyam pariggahaḥ
translated: In the Āyatta and Parivāra, and in the Bhariyāyaṃ pariggaha,

original: Uttaṃso tva’ vataṃso ca, kaṇṇapūre ca sekhare.
analyzed: uttaṃso ca kaṇṇapūre ca sekhare
translated: The words uttaṃsa and avataṃsa are used for earrings, and sekhara for a crest-jewel.

original: Vijjuyaṃ vajire cevā, sani’tthipurise pyatha;
analyzed: vijjuyam vajire ca iva sanitthipurise
translated: In the Vijjuya and Vajira, and in the Sani’tthi and Purise,

original: Koṇe saṅkhyāvisesasmiṃ, ukkaṃse koṭi nāriyaṃ.
analyzed: koṇe saṅkhyā visesasmiṃ ukkaṃse
translated: The words koṇa and saṅkhyā are used for a corner, and ukkaṃsa for a crest-jewel.

original: Cūḷā jālā padhāna’gga, moracūḷāsu sā sikhā;
analyzed: cūḷā jālā moracūḷāsu sā sikhā
translated: The words cūḷā and jālā are used for the top of the head, and moracūḷā for a crest-jewel.

original: Sappadāṭhāya māsī’tthī, iṭṭhassā’sīsanāyapi.
analyzed: sappada āṭhāya māsi itthī
translated: The words sappadāṭhā and māsī are used for a month, and iṭṭha for a head-ornament.

original: Vasā vilīna telasmiṃ, vasagā vañjhagāvisu;
analyzed: vasā telasmin
translated: The words vasā and vilīna are used for oil, and vasagā and vañjhagā for a cow.

original: Abhilāse tu kiraṇe, abhisaṅge ruci’tthiyaṃ.
analyzed: abhilāse tu kiraṇe abhisaṅge rucitthiyam
translated: The words abhilāsa and kiraṇa are used for a ray, and abhisanga for a liking.

original: Saññā sañjānane nāme, cetanāyañca dissati;
analyzed: saññā sañjānane nāme cetanāyañca dissati
translated: The words saññā and sañjānana are used for the act of perceiving, and cetanā for volition.

original: Aṃse sippe kalā kāle, bhāge candassa soḷase.
analyzed: aṃse sippe kalā kāle bhāge candassa soḷase
translated: The words aṃsa and siddhi are used for a branch of knowledge, and kalā for a part, and the sixteenth part of the moon.

original: Bījakose gharakūṭe, kaṇṇabhūsāya kaṇṇikā;
analyzed: bīja kose ghara kūṭe kaṇṇa bhūsāya kaṇṇikā
translated: The words bījakosa and gharakūṭa are used for a seed-pod, and kaṇṇabhūsā for an earring.

original: Āgāmikāle dīghatte, pabhāve ca matā’yati.🔽Uṇṇā mesādilome, ca, bhūmajjhe romadhātuyaṃ;
analyzed: āgāmi kāle dīghatte pa bhāve ca matāyati  uṇṇā mesa ādi lome ca bhū majjhe
translated: The words āgāmi and dīgha are used for the future, and pabhāva for a state of being.🔽The words uṇṇā and mesā are used for body-hair, and bhūmajjhe for the hair of the body.

original: Vāruṇī tvitthiyaṃ vuttā, naṭṭakī madirādisu.
analyzed: vāruṇī tu itthiyam vuttā naṭṭakī madirā ādisu
translated: The words vāruṇī and itthi are used for a female spirit, and naṭṭakī for a female spirit who drinks liquor.

original: Kriyacitte ca karaṇe, kiriyaṃ kammani kriyā;🔽Sunisāyaṃ tu kaññāya, jāyāya ca vadhū matā.🔽Pamāṇi’ssariye mattā, akkharāvayave’ppake;
analyzed: kriya citte ca karaṇe kiriyam kammani kriyā  tu kaññāya jāyāya ca vadhū matā  pamāṇissariye mattāḥ akkhara avayaveppake
translated: And in the doing of a deed, in the doing of an action, in the doing of a work,🔽But in the case of a girl who is not yet married, and in the case of a wife, the word vadhū is used.🔽In the case of a measure, in the case of a quantity, in the case of a letter, in the case of a syllable,

original: Suttaṃ pāvacane riṭṭhe siddhe (ṭī.), tante taṃ supite tisu.
analyzed: suttam pā vacane riṭṭhe siddhe ṭī tante tam sup ite tisu
translated: In the case of a thread, in the case of a line, in the case of a cloth, in the case of a bed, in the case of the three.

original: Rājaliṅgo’sabhaṅgesu, rukkhe ca kakudo kakudho pyatha;🔽Nimitta’kkhara sūpesu, byañjanaṃ cihane pade.
analyzed: rājaliṅga usabhaṅgesu rukkhe ca kakudaḥ kakudhaḥ pi atha  nimitta kkhara sūpesu byañjanam cihane pade
translated: In the case of a king, in the case of a sign, in the case of a tree, in the case of a top, in the case of a top-knot,🔽In the case of a mark, in the case of a letter, in the case of a soup, in the case of a seasoning, in the case of a sign, in the case of a word.

original: Vohāre jetu micchāyaṃ, kīḷādo cāpi devanaṃ;
analyzed: vohāre jetu micchāyam ca api devanam
translated: In the case of a language, in the case of a wrong path, in the case of a play, in the case of a gambling,

original: Bhariyāyaṃ tu kedāre, sarīre khetta mīritaṃ.
analyzed: tu kedāre sarīre khetta mīritam
translated: In the case of a wife, in the case of a field, in the case of a body, in the case of a dead person.

original: Sussūsāyañca viññeyyaṃ, issābhyāse pyu’pāsanaṃ;
analyzed: viññeyyam issā abhyāse pi upāsanam
translated: In the case of a desire to learn, in the case of a jealousy, in the case of a practice, in the case of a worship,

original: Sūlaṃ tu nitthiyaṃ heti, bhede saṃku rujāsu ca.🔽Tanti vīṇāguṇe, tantaṃ, mukhyasiddhanta tantusu;
analyzed: sūlam tu nitthiyam heti bhede saṃku rujāsu ca  vīṇā guṇe tantam tantusu
translated: In the case of a stake, in the case of a weapon, in the case of a split, in the case of a wound, in the case of a pain.🔽In the case of a thread, in the case of a lute, in the case of a string, in the case of a thread, in the case of a principal, in the case of a conclusion, in the case of a thread,

original: Rathādyaṅge tu ca yugo, kappamhi yugale yugaṃ.
analyzed: ratha ādi aṅge tu ca yugaḥ yugale yugam
translated: In the case of a chariot, in the case of a limb, in the case of a yoke, in the case of a pair, in the case of a yoke.

original: Itthipupphe ca reṇumhi, rajo pakatije guṇe;
analyzed: itthi pupphe ca reṇumhi rajaḥ pakati je guṇe
translated: In the case of a woman, in the case of a flower, in the case of a dust, in the case of a dirt, in the case of a natural quality,

original: Nyāsappaṇe tu dānamhi, niyyātana mudīritaṃ.
analyzed: tu
translated: In the case of a deposit, in the case of a gift, in the case of a giving, in the case of a dedication, is said.

original: Garu’pāyā’vatāresu, titthaṃ pūtambu diṭṭhisu;
analyzed: tittham diṭṭhisu
translated: In the Garu’pāyā’vatāresu, titthaṃ pūtambu diṭṭhisu;

original: Paṇḍake joti nakkhatta, raṃsīsva’ggimhi joti so.
analyzed: paṇḍake joti nakkhatta raṃsi su aggimhi joti so
translated: Paṇḍake joti nakkhatta, raṃsīsva’ggimhi joti so.

original: Kaṇḍo nitthī sare daṇḍe, vagge cāvasare pyatha;
analyzed: kaṇḍaḥ nitthī sare daṇḍe vagge ca avasare pi atha
translated: Kaṇḍo nitthī sare daṇḍe, vagge cāvasare pyatha;

original: Uddhaṃbāhudvayamāne bāhudvayummāne, sūrattepi ca porisaṃ.
analyzed: ca porisam
translated: Uddhaṃbāhudvayamāne bāhudvayummāne, sūrattepi ca porisaṃ.

original: Uṭṭhānaṃ porise’hāsu, nisinnādyu’ggame pyatha;
analyzed: uṭṭhānam porisehāsu nisinna ādi yuggame pi atha
translated: Uṭṭhānaṃ porise’hāsu, nisinnādyu’ggame pyatha;

original: Anissayamahībhāge, tvi’rīṇaṃ ūsare siyā.
analyzed: a nissaya mahībhāge ūsare siyā
translated: Anissayamahībhāge, tvi’rīṇaṃ ūsare siyā.

original: Ārādhanaṃ sādhane ca, pattiyaṃ paritosane;
analyzed: ārādhanam sādhane ca pattiyam paritosane
translated: Ārādhanaṃ sādhane ca, pattiyaṃ paritosane;

original: Padhāne tu ca sānumhi, visāṇe siṅga muccate.
analyzed: padhāne tu ca sānumhi visāṇe muccate
translated: Padhāne tu ca sānumhi, visāṇe siṅga muccate.

original: Diṭṭhā’dimagge ñāṇa’kkhi, kkhaṇa laddhīsu dassanaṃ;
analyzed: diṭṭha ādi magge ñāṇa kkhi kkhaṇa laddhīsu dassanaṃ
translated: Diṭṭhā’dimagge ñāṇa’kkhi, kkhaṇa laddhīsu dassanaṃ;

original: Heme pañcasuvaṇṇe ca, nikkho nitthī pasādhane.
analyzed: heme pañcasuvaṇṇe ca nikkhaḥ nitthī pasādhane
translated: Heme pañcasuvaṇṇe ca, nikkho nitthī pasādhane.

original: Tithibhede ca sākhādi, phaḷumhi pabba muccate;
analyzed: tithi bhede ca sākhā ādi phaḷumhi muccate
translated: Tithibhede ca sākhādi, phaḷumhi pabba muccate;

original: Nāgaloke tu pātālaṃ, bhāsitaṃ balavāmukhe.
analyzed: nāga loke tu pātālam bhāsitam
translated: Nāgaloke tu pātālaṃ, bhāsitaṃ balavāmukhe.

original: Kāmaje kopaje dose, byasanañca vipattiyaṃ;
analyzed: kāma je kopa je dose byasanam ca
translated: Kāmaje kopaje dose, byasanañca vipattiyaṃ;

original: Atho’pakaraṇe siddhi, kārakesu ca sādhanaṃ.
analyzed: atha upakaraṇe kārakesu ca sādhanam
translated: Atho’pakaraṇe siddhi, kārakesu ca sādhanaṃ.

original: Tīsvīrito tīsvito (ṭī.) dānasīle, vadaññū vagguvādini;
analyzed: tīsu īr itaḥ tīsu itaḥ ṭī dāna sīle vadaññū vaggu vādini
translated: Tīsvīrito, tīsvito, dānasīle, vadaññū, vagguvādini,

original: Purakkhato bhisitte ca, pūjite puratokate.
analyzed: purakkhataḥ bhisitte ca pūjite puratokate
translated: Purakkhato, bhisitte ca, pūjite, puratokate.

original: Mando bhāgyavihīne cā, ppake mūḷhā’paṭūsvapi;
analyzed: mandaḥ bhāgya vihīne ca ppake mūḍhā paṭūsu api
translated: Mando, bhāgyavihīne ca, ppake, mūḷhā, ’paṭūsvapi;

original: Vuddhiyutte samunnaddhe, uppanne ussitaṃ bhave.
analyzed: vuddhi yutte samunnaddhe uppanne ussitam bhave
translated: Vuddhiyutte, samunnaddhe, uppanne, ussitaṃ bhave.

original: Rathaṅge’kkho suvaṇṇasmiṃ, pāsake, akkha mindriye;
analyzed: rathaṅga īkkhaḥ suvaṇṇasmin pāsake akkha m indriye
translated: Rathaṅge, akkho, suvaṇṇasmiṃ, pāsake, akkho, mindriye;

original: Sassate ca dhuvo tīsu, dhuvaṃ takke ca nicchite.
analyzed: sassate ca dhuvaḥ tīsu dhuvam takke ca nicchite
translated: Sassate ca, dhuvo, tīsu, dhuvaṃ, takke ca, nicchite.

original: Hare sivo, sivaṃ bhadda, mokkhesu, jambuke sivā;
analyzed: hare sivaḥ sivam bhadda mokkhesu jambuke sivā
translated: Hare, sivo, sivaṃ, bhadda, mokkhesu, jambuke, sivā;

original: Senāyaṃ sattiyañceva, thūlatte ca balaṃ bhave.
analyzed: ca balam bhave
translated: Senāyaṃ, sattiyañceva, thūlatte ca, balaṃ bhave.

original: Saṅkhyā narakabhedesu, padumaṃ vārije pyatha;
analyzed: saṅkhyā naraka bhedesu padumam vāri je pi atha
translated: Saṅkhyā, narakabhedesu, padumaṃ, vārije, pyatha;

original: Devabhede vasu pume, paṇḍakaṃ ratane dhane.
analyzed: deva bhede vasu pume paṇḍakam ratane dhane
translated: Devabhede, vasu, pume, paṇḍakaṃ, ratane, dhane.

original: Nibbānaṃ atthagamane, apavagge siyā tha ca;
analyzed: nibbānam attha gamane apavagge siyā tha ca
translated: Nibbānaṃ, atthagamane, apavagge, siyā, tha ca;

original: Setambuje puṇḍarīkaṃ, byagghe rukkhantare pume.
analyzed: puṇḍarīkam byagghe rukkhantare pume
translated: Setambuje, puṇḍarīkaṃ, byagghe, rukkhantare, pume.

original: Upahāre bali pume, karasmiṃcā’surantare;
analyzed: upahāre bali pume karasmin ca asuḥ antare
translated: Upahāre, bali, pume, karasmiṃ, cā’surantare;

original: Sukkaṃ tu sambhave, sukko, dhavale, kusale tisu.
analyzed: sukkam tu sambhave sukkaḥ dhavale kusale tisu
translated: Sukkaṃ, tu, sambhave, sukko, dhavale, kusale, tisu.

original: Dāyo dāne vibhattabba, dhane ca pitunaṃ vane dhane (ṭī.);
analyzed: dāyaḥ dāne dhane ca pitunam vane dhane ṭī
translated: Dāyo is the share in a division, and in a forest belonging to the father;

original: Pabhuttā’yattatā’yattā’, bhilāsesu vaso bhave.
analyzed: abhilāsesu vasaḥ bhave
translated: Pabhuttā is ‘not eaten’, ‘not used’, and ‘not used up’; ‘āyatta’ is ‘dependent’, ‘āyatta’ is ‘not dependent’; ‘bhilāsa’ is ‘desire’, and ‘vaya’ is ‘age’.

original: Paribhāsana makkose, niyame bhāsane tha ca,
analyzed: paribhāsana makkose niyame bhāsane tha ca
translated: Paribhāsana is ‘reproach’, ‘makkose’ is ‘in a quarrel’, ‘niyame’ is ‘in a rule’, and ‘bhāsane’ is ‘in a speech’.

original: Dhanamhi seḷanaṃ yodha, sīhanādamhi dissati.
analyzed: dhanamhi seḷanam yodha sīha nādamhi dissati
translated: Dhanamhi is ‘in wealth’, ‘seḷanaṃ’ is ‘a kind of gambling’, and ‘yodha’ is ‘if’.

original: Pabhavo jātihetumhi, ṭhāne cādyupaladdhiyaṃ;
analyzed: pabhavaḥ jāti hetumhi ṭhāne
translated: Pabhavo is ‘origin’, ‘jāti’ is ‘birth’, ‘hetu’ is ‘cause’, ‘ṭhāne’ is ‘in a place’, and ‘ādyupaladdhiyaṃ’ is ‘in the first discovery’.

original: Atho’tu nāripupphasmiṃ, hemantādimhi ca dvisu.
analyzed: nāri pupphasmim hemanta ādimhi ca dvisu
translated: Atho is ‘but’, ‘nāripupphasmiṃ’ is ‘in a flower of the nāri tree’, and ‘hemantādimhi ca dvisu’ is ‘in the two, the winter season, etc.’.

original: Karaṇaṃ sādhakatame, kriyā gattesu indriye;
analyzed: karaṇam sādhakatame kriyā indriye
translated: Karaṇaṃ is ‘instrument’, ‘sādhakatame’ is ‘most effective’, ‘kriyā’ is ‘action’, ‘gattesu’ is ‘in cases’, and ‘indriye’ is ‘in a faculty’.

original: Tāto tāḷo (sī.) tu kuñcikāyañca, tūriyaṅge dumantare.
analyzed: tu kuñcikāyañca tūriyaṅge dumantare
translated: Tāto is ‘from that’, ‘tāḷo’ is ‘a kind of tree’, ‘tu’ is ‘but’, ‘kuñcikāyañca’ is ‘in a key’, and ‘tūriyaṅge’ is ‘in a musical instrument’.

original: Pupphe phale ca pasavo, uppāde gabbhamocane;
analyzed: pupphe phale ca pasavaḥ uppāde gabbha mocane
translated: Pupphe is ‘in a flower’, ‘phale’ is ‘in a fruit’, ‘pasavo’ is ‘an animal’, ‘uppāde’ is ‘in production’, ‘gabbhamocane’ is ‘in the delivery of a child’,

original: Gāyane gāyake asse, gandhabbo devatāntare.
analyzed: gāyane gāyake asse gandhabbaḥ devatā antare
translated: ‘gāyane’ is ‘in singing’, ‘gāyake’ is ‘in a singer’, ‘asse’ is ‘in a horse’, and ‘gandhabbo’ is ‘a gandhabba’, ‘devatāntare’ is ‘in another deity’.

original: Vinā pupphaṃ phalaggāhi, rukkhe vanappati;🔽Āhate hemarajate, rūpiyaṃ rajatepi ca.🔽Khagādibandhane pāso, kesapubbo caye pyatha;🔽Tārā’kkhimajjhe nakkhatte, tāro uccatarassare.🔽Patte ca lohabhedasmiṃ, kaṃso catukahāpaṇe;
analyzed: vinā puppham phala ggāhi rukkhe 🔽āhate hema rajate ca 🔽khaga ādi bandhane pāsaḥ kesapubbaḥ caye pyatha 🔽tāra akkhi majjhe nakkhatte tāraḥ uccatarassare 🔽patte ca loha bhedasmin kaṃso catu kahāpaṇe
translated: Vinā is ‘without’, ‘pupphaṃ’ is ‘a flower’, ‘phalaggāhi’ is ‘a fruit-gatherer’,

original: Majjhimo dehamajjhasmiṃ, majjhabhave ca so tisu.
analyzed: majjhimaḥ deha majjhasmim majjha bhave ca saḥ tisu
translated: The middle one is in the middle of the body, and in the middle of the three kinds of becoming.

original: Āvesanaṃbhūtāvese, sippasālā gharesu ca;
analyzed: sippa sālāḥ gharesu ca
translated: A house is a dwelling, and a workshop is a house;

original: Sobhā sampattīsu sirī, lakkhītthī devatāya ca.
analyzed: sobhā sampattīsu sirī lakkhītthī devatāya ca
translated: Beauty is success, and Lakkhi is a goddess.

original: Kumāro yuvarāje ca, khande vutto susumhi ca;
analyzed: kumāraḥ yuvarāje ca khande vutto susumhi ca
translated: A prince is a youth, and a branch is called a shoot;

original: Athā’nitthī pavāḷo ca, maṇibhede tathā’ṅkure.
analyzed: atha anitthī pavāḷaḥ ca maṇi bhede tathā aṅkure
translated: Then a woman is a female, and a coral tree is a Pavala tree.

original: Paṇo vetana mūlesu, vohāre ca dhane mato;
analyzed: paṇaḥ vetana mūlesu vohāre ca dhane mato
translated: A wage is a price, and wealth is reckoned in money;

original: Paṭiggaho tu gahaṇe, kathito bhājanantare.
analyzed: paṭiggahaḥ tu gahaṇe kathitaḥ bhājana antare
translated: Acceptance is taking, and it is called a vessel.

original: Asubhe ca subhe kamme, bhāgyaṃ vuttaṃ dvaye pyatha;
analyzed: asubhe ca subhe kamme bhāgyam vuttam dvaye
translated: And in the two kinds of good and bad deeds, and in the two kinds of good fortune;

original: Pipphalaṃ tarubhede ca, vatthacchedanasatthake.
analyzed: pipphalam taru bhede ca vattha chedana satthake
translated: And a fruit is a kind of tree, and a knife is a cutting instrument.

original: Apavaggo pariccāgā’, vasānesu vimuttiyaṃ;🔽Liṅgaṃ tu aṅgajātasmiṃ, pumattādimhi lakkhaṇe.
analyzed: apavaggo pariccāgāḥ vasānesu vimuttiyam  liṅgam tu aṅga jātasmin pumat tā ādimhi lakkhaṇe
translated: A class is a giving up, and in the two kinds of freedom it is a control;🔽A sign is in the male and female organs, and in the characteristics of masculinity, etc.

original: Cāge sabhāve nimmāne, saggo jjhāye divepyatha;
analyzed: cāge sabhāve nimmāne saggaḥ jjhāye dive pyatha
translated: In the two kinds of creation it is a creation, and in the two kinds of light it is a light;

original: Rohito lohite maccha, bhede ceva migantare.
analyzed: rohitaḥ lohite maccha bhede ca iva migantare
translated: A Rohita fish is a red fish, and a deer is a kind of animal.

original: Niṭṭhā nipphattiyaṃ cevā, vasānamhi adassane;
analyzed: niṭṭhā nipphattiyam ca iva ā vasānamhi a dassane
translated: And in the two kinds of accomplishment it is a completion, and in the two kinds of control it is a non-appearance;

original: Kaṇṭako tu sapattasmiṃ, rukkhaṅge lomahaṃsane.
analyzed: kaṇṭakaḥ tu ruj khaṅge loma haṃsane
translated: And a thorn is an enemy, and in a tree it is a hair-raising thing.

original: Mukhyo’pāyesu vadane, ādismiṃ mukha mīritaṃ;
analyzed: vadane ādismin
translated: The word mukhya is used for the chief of means, in the face, and in the beginning;

original: Dabbaṃ bhabbe guṇādhāre, vitte ca budha dārusu.
analyzed: dabbam bhabbe guṇa ādhāre vitte ca budha dārusu
translated: Dabba is used for a good person, one who can, and for a store of good qualities, and for wealth, O wise one, and for wood.

original: Mānaṃ pamāṇe patthādo, māno vutto vidhāya ca;
analyzed: mānam pamāṇe pattha adaḥ mānaḥ vuttaḥ vidhāya ca
translated: The word māna is used for a measure, for a desire, and for pride, and for a rule, and for a mode.

original: Atho parissame vutto, vāyāmo vīriyepi ca.🔽Saroruhe satapattaṃ, satapatto khagantare;🔽Chidde tu chiddavante ca, susiraṃ tūriyantare.🔽Ekasmiṃ sadise sante, samānaṃ vāccaliṅgikaṃ;🔽Atho gārava bhītīsu, saṃvege sambhamo mato.🔽Juṇhā candappabhāyañca, tadupetanisāya ca;
analyzed: atho parissame vuttaḥ vāyāmaḥ vīriye pi ca  saroruhe khaga antare  chidde tu chiddavante ca susiram tūriyantare  ekasmin sadise sante samānam vāccaliṅgikam  atho gārava bhītīsu saṃvege sambhamaḥ mataḥ  candappabhāyam ca ca
translated: And the word vāyāma is used for effort, and for exertion, and for trouble, and for energy.

original: Vimānaṃ devatāvāse, sattabhūmigharamhi ca.🔽Māse jeṭṭho, tivuddhā’ti, ppasatthesu ca tīsu so;🔽Dhamme ca maṅgale seyyo, so pasatthatare tisu.🔽Ādiccādimhi gahaṇe, nibandhe ca ghare gaho;🔽Kāco tu mattikābhede, sikkāyaṃ nayanāmaye.🔽Tīsu gāmaṇi seṭṭhasmiṃ, adhipe gāmajeṭṭhake;
analyzed: vimānam devatā vāse ca 🔽māse jeṭṭhaḥ ti vuddhā ati ppasatthesu ca tīsu so 🔽dhamme ca maṅgale seyyo saḥ pasatthatare tisu 🔽ādi cca ādimhi gahaṇe nibandhe ca ghare gaho 🔽kācaḥ tu mattikā bhede sikkāyam nayana āmaye 🔽tīsu seṭṭhasmin adhipe gāma jeṭṭhake
translated: The word saroruha is used for a lotus, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower, and for a hundred-leaved flower,

original: Bimbaṃ tu paṭibimbe ca, maṇḍale bimbikāphale.
analyzed: bimbam tu paṭibimbe ca maṇḍale bimbikā phale
translated: A mirror, and also a reflection, a circle, and the fruit of a Bimbīka.

original: Bhājanādi parikkhāre, bhaṇḍaṃ mūladhanepi ca;
analyzed: bhājana ādi parikkhāre bhaṇḍam mūla dhane pi ca
translated: A vessel, etc., and also a requisite, goods, and also capital.

original: Maggo tvariyamagge ca, sammādiṭṭhādike, pathe.🔽Samā vasse, samo kheda, santīsu, so nibhe tisu;
analyzed: maggo tu ariya magge ca sammādiṭṭha ādike pathe  samā vasse samaḥ kheda santīsu saḥ nibhe tisu
translated: A path, and also a way, and in a right view, etc., a path.🔽Equal, and also a year, equal, and also a burden, in three, peaceful, and in three, stainless.

original: Cāpetvissāsa, musuno, issāso khepakamhi ca.🔽Bālo tīsvā’divayasā, samaṅgini apaṇḍite;🔽Rattaṃ tu soṇite, tambā, nuratta, rañjite tisu.🔽Tace kāye ca tanvitthī, tīsva’ppe viraḷe kise;🔽Utubhede tu sisiro, hime so sītale tisu.🔽Sakkharā guḷabhede ca, kathalepi ca dissati;🔽Anuggahe tu saṅkhepe, gahaṇe saṅgaho mato.
analyzed: musunaḥ issāsaḥ khepakamhi ca  samaṅgini apaṇḍite  rattam tu soṇite tambā nuratta rañjite tisu  tace kāye ca tanu itthī tīsvappe viraḷe kise  utu bhede tu sisiraḥ hime saḥ sītale tisu  sakkharā guḷabhede ca kathale pi ca dissati  anuggahe tu saṅkhepe gahaṇe saṅgahaḥ mataḥ
translated: Having taken off, and also a hope, and also envy, and also a blow.

original: Dakkhe ca tikhiṇe byatte, rogamutte paṭuttisu;🔽Rājā tu khattiye vutto, naranāthe pabhumhi ca.🔽Khalañca dhaññakaraṇe, kakke nīce khalo bhave;🔽Athu’ppāde samudayo, samūhe paccayepi ca.
analyzed: dakkhe ca tikhiṇe byatte roga mutte paṭuttisu 🔽rājā tu khattiye vuttaḥ naranāthe pabhumhi ca 🔽khalañca dhañña karaṇe kakke nīce khalaḥ bhave 🔽atha uppāde samudayaḥ samūhe paccaye pi ca
translated: A fool, and also in three, a day, and also a year, and also a month, and also a fortnight, and also a season, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also a year, and also

original: Brahmacārī gahaṭṭhādo, assamo ca tapovane;
analyzed: brahmacārī gahaṭṭhādaḥ assamaḥ ca tapovane
translated: A celibate, a householder, a forest, and a penance grove;

original: Bhayaṅkare tu kaṭhine, kurūro tīsu niddaye.
analyzed: bhayaṅkare tu kaṭhine kurūraḥ tīsu niddaye
translated: In a fearful, in a difficult, in the Kuru country, in three (kinds of) enmity.

original: Kaniṭṭho kaniyo tīsu, atyappe’tiyuve pyatha;🔽Sīghamhi lahu taṃ, iṭṭha, nissārā’garusuttisu.
analyzed: kaniṭṭhaḥ kaniyaḥ tīsu pi atha  sīghamhi lahu taṃ nissāra agaru suttisu
translated: The youngest, the smallest, in three (kinds of) enmity, and also in the case of a young man who is too young;🔽In the case of a swift, a light, a desirable, a worthless, in three (kinds of) low (people).

original: Adharo tīsvadho hīne, pume dantacchade pyatha;
analyzed: adharaḥ tī su adhaḥ hīne pume dantacchade pi atha
translated: The lowest, in three (kinds of) low (people), in the case of a man, and also in the case of teeth and lips;

original: Sussusā sotu micchāya, sā pāricariyāya ca.🔽Hattho pāṇimhi ratane, gaṇe soṇḍāya bhantare;🔽Āvāṭe udapāne ca, kūpo kumbhe ca dissati.
analyzed: sussusā sotu micchāya sā pāricariyāya ca  hattho pāṇimhi ratane gaṇe soṇḍāya bhantare  āvāṭe udapāne ca kūpaḥ kumbhe ca dissati
translated: In the case of a corpse, in the case of hearing wrongly, and in the case of attending on (others).🔽A hand, in the case of a palm, in the case of a jewel, in the case of a nose, in the case of an interior;🔽In a pit, in a well, in a water-pot, and also in the case of a pot.

original: Ādo padhāne paṭhamaṃ, pamukhañca tiliṅgikaṃ;
analyzed: ādaḥ padhāne paṭhamam tiliṅgikam
translated: In the beginning, in the case of a chief, in the case of a first (person), and also in the case of a beginning;

original: Vajjabhede ca vita taṃ, taṃ vitthāre tiliṅgikaṃ.🔽Sāro bale thiraṃse ca, uttame so tiliṅgiko;
analyzed: vajja bhede ca vita tam tam vitthāre tiliṅgikam  sāraḥ bale thiraṃse ca uttame saḥ tiliṅgiko
translated: In the case of a division of duties, in the case of a spread, that is in the case of an expansion, in the case of a beginning.🔽In the case of a core, in the case of a power, in the case of a firm (person), in the case of an excellent (person), that is in the case of a beginning.

original: Bhāro tu khandhabhārādo, dvisahassapalepi ca.
analyzed: bhāraḥ tu ca
translated: In the case of a burden, in the case of a load of bundles, and also in the case of a covering of two thousand (coins).

original: Mandire rogabhede ca, khayo apacayamhi ca;
analyzed: mandire roga bhede ca ca
translated: In the case of a palace, in the case of a division of diseases, in the case of a wasting away, and in the case of a decrease;

original: Vāḷo tu sāpade sappe, kurūre so tiliṅgiko.
analyzed: vāḷaḥ tu sāpade sappe kurūre saḥ tiliṅgikaḥ
translated: In the case of a fence, in the case of a snake, in the case of a snake-bite, in the case of a Kuru (disease), that is in the case of a beginning.

original: Sālo sajjaddume rukkhe, sālāgehe ca dissati;
analyzed: sālaḥ sajjat dume rukkhe sālā gehe ca dissati
translated: In the case of a sala tree, in the case of a tree with a saddle, in the case of a house with a sala tree, it is seen.

original: Sote tu savanaṃ vuttaṃ, yajane sutiyampi ca.
analyzed: sote tu savanam vuttam yajane sutiyam pi ca
translated: In the ear, hearing is stated, and in the sacrifice, also listening.

original: Tīsu pato pareto ca, mate ca petayonije;🔽Khyāte tu haṭṭhe viññāte, patītaṃ vāccaliṅgikaṃ.
analyzed: tīsu ca ca  khyāte tu haṭṭhe viññāte patītam vāccaliṅgikam
translated: In the three, and in the other, and in the departed, and in the departed one born in the realm of ghosts;🔽In the well-known, in the delighted, in the known, and in the fallen, the gender of the word is feminine.

original: Adhippāye ca ādhāre, āsayo kathito tha ca;
analyzed: adhippāye ca ādhāre āsayo kathito tha ca
translated: And in the intention, and in the basis, the abode is stated, and the place.

original: Pattaṃ pakkhe dale, patto, bhājane so gate tisu.
analyzed: pattam pakkhe dale pattaḥ bhājane saḥ gate tisu
translated: In the wing, in the leaf, in the bowl, it is fallen, and in the three, it has gone.

original: Kusale sukataṃ, suṭṭhu, kate ca sukato tisu;
analyzed: kusale su katam suṭṭhu kate ca su kataḥ tisu
translated: In the wholesome, well-done, and in the three, well-made;

original: Tapassī tva’nukampāyā, rahe vutto tapodhane.
analyzed: tapassī tu anukampāyāḥ rahe vuttaḥ tapodhane
translated: And in the ascetic, in compassion, in the treasure of austerities, it is said to be hidden.

original: Tīsu surādilolasmiṃ, soṇḍo hatthikare dvisu;
analyzed: tīsu surā ādi lolasmin soṇḍaḥ hatthi kare dvisu
translated: In the three, in the intoxicated with liquor, etc., the trunk, and in the two, in the elephant driver;

original: Assādane tu rasanaṃ, jivhāyañca dhanimhi ca.
analyzed: assādane tu rasanam ca
translated: In the enjoyment of horses, the tongue, and in the rich, in the tongue.

original: Paṇīto tīsu madhure, uttame vihite pyatha;
analyzed: tīsu madhure uttame vihite
translated: In the three, excellent, sweet, and also in the prepared, and in the best;

original: Añjase visikhāyañca, pantiyaṃ vīthi nāriyaṃ.🔽Pāpasmiṃ gagane dukkhe, byasane cā’gha muccate;
analyzed: añjase visikhāyañca pantiyam vīthi nāriyam  pāpasmim gagane dukkhe byasane ca agha muccate
translated: In the ointment, in the ray, and in the path, the street, the road.🔽In the evil, in the sky, in suffering, and in the calamity, the sin is released;

original: Samūhe paṭalaṃ netta, roge vuttaṃ chadimhi ca.
analyzed: samūhe paṭalam roge vuttam chadimhi ca
translated: In the mass, the cloud, the eye, and in the six, it is said to be disease.

original: Sandhi saṅghaṭṭane vutto, sandhi’tthi paṭisandhiyaṃ;
analyzed: sandhi saṅghaṭṭane vuttaḥ sandhitthi paṭisandhiyam
translated: In the connection, the joining is stated, and in the joint, in the bone, in the connecting;

original: Sattannaṃ pūraṇe seṭṭhe, tisante sattamo tisu.
analyzed: pūraṇe seṭṭhe tisante sattamaḥ tisu
translated: In the filling of the seven, the best, in the three, the seventh in the three.

original: Ojā tu yāpanāyañca, ojo ditti balesu ca;
analyzed: ojā tu yāpanāyañca ojaḥ ditti balesu ca
translated: “Juice” is for sustaining, and “juice” in the faculties of seeing and so on,

original: Atho nisāmanaṃ vuttaṃ, dassane savanepi ca.
analyzed: atho nisāmanam vuttam dassane savane api ca
translated: And also “restraint” is said in the case of seeing and hearing.

original: Gabbho kucchiṭṭhasatte ca, kucchi ovarakesu ca;
analyzed: gabbhaḥ kucchiṭṭhasatte ca kucchi ovarakesu ca
translated: “Womb” is for beings in the belly, and “belly” is for the intestines,

original: Khaṇḍane tva’padānañca, itivutte ca kammani.
analyzed: khaṇḍane tu apadānam ca iti vutte ca kammani
translated: And “breaking” is for the limbs, and “so it is said” is for the action.

original: Cittake rukkhabhede ca, tilako tilakāḷake;
analyzed: cittake rukkha bhede ca tilakaḥ tilakāḷake
translated: “Mark” is for the mind, and “mark” is for the tree, and “mark” is for the black mark,

original: Sīlādo paṭipatti’tthī, bodhe patti pavattisu.
analyzed: sīla ādaḥ paṭipatti itthī bodhe patti pavattisu
translated: And “moral discipline” is for the practice, and “there is” is for the enlightenment, and “attainment” is for the occurrence.

original: Asumhi āyumhi (ṭī.), 407-gāthā passitabbā ca bale pāṇo, satte hadayagā’nile;🔽Chando vase adhippāye, vede’cchā’nuṭṭhubhādisu.
analyzed: asumhi āyumhi ṭī passitabbā ca bale pāṇo satte hadaya ga anile  chandaḥ vase adhippāye veda icchā anuṭṭhubha ādisu
translated: “Life” is for the life faculty, and the verse should be seen in the case of the faculties, and “breath” is for beings, and “heart” is for the wind in the heart.🔽“Desire” is for the state of being, and “intention” is for the purpose, and “knowledge” is for the wish, and “aspiration” is for the desire and so on.

original: Kāmoghādo, samūhasmiṃ, oghovege jalassa ca;🔽Kapālaṃ sirasaṭṭhimhi, ghaṭādi sakalepi ca.
analyzed: samūhasmin ogha uvege jalassa ca  kapālam ghaṭa ādi sakale pi ca
translated: “Flood” is for the destruction of desire, and “flood” is for the mass, and “flood” is for the speed of the water,🔽And “skull” is for the head, and “pot” and so on are for the whole.

original: Veṇvādisākhājālasmiṃ, laggakese jaṭā’laye;
analyzed: veṇu ādi sākhā jālasmin lagga kese jaṭālaye
translated: “Reed” and so on are for the net of branches, and “tangle” is for the hair, and “tangle” is for the matted hair.

original: Saraṇaṃ tu vadhe gehe, rakkhitasmiñca rakkhaṇe.🔽Thiyaṃ kantā piye, kanto, manuññe, so tiliṅgiko;
analyzed: saraṇam tu vadhe gehe rakkhitasmin ca rakkhaṇe  thiyam kantā piye kantaḥ manuññe so tiliṅgiko
translated: “Refuge” is for killing, and “refuge” is for the house, and “protection” is for the guarding.🔽“Good” is for the beloved, and “good” is for the dear, and “good” is for the agreeable, and “good” is for the three genders.

original: Gavakkhe tu samūhe ca, jālaṃ macchādibandhane.
analyzed: gavakkhe tu samūhe ca jālam maccha ādi bandhane
translated: “Net” is for the mass, and “net” is for the catching of fish and so on.

original: Pucchāyaṃ garahāyañcā, niyame kiṃ tiliṅgikaṃ;
analyzed: niyame kim tiliṅgikam
translated: In the question and in the blame, in the rule, what is the three-gendered?

original: Sasaddhe tīsu nivāpe, saddhaṃ, saddhā ca paccaye.
analyzed: sa saddhe tīsu nivāpe saddham saddhā ca paccaye
translated: In the three kinds of confidence, confidence, faith, in the conditions.

original: Bījaṃ hetumhi aṭṭhismiṃ, aṅgajāte ca dissati;
analyzed: bījam hetumhi aṭṭhismim aṅga jāte ca dissati
translated: Seed is in the cause, in the bone, and it is seen in the limbs.

original: Pubbo pūye’ggato aggate (ṭī.) ādo,
analyzed: pubbaḥ pūya iggataḥ aggate ṭī ādaḥ
translated: Pus is in the pus, the head is in the head, the beginning is in the beginning,

original: So disādo tiliṅgiko.
analyzed: saḥ disādaḥ tiliṅgikaḥ
translated: That is in the direction, it is three-gendered.

original: Phalacitte hetukate, lābhe dhaññādike phalaṃ;
analyzed: phala citte hetukate lābhe dhaññā ādike phalam
translated: In the mind of fruition, in the cause, in the gain, the fruit is in the grain, etc.

original: Āgamane tu dīghādi, nikāyesu ca āgamo.
analyzed: āgamane tu dīgha ādi nikāyesu ca āgamaḥ
translated: But in the coming, the long, etc., in the groups, the coming.

original: Santāno devarukkhe ca, vutto santatiyaṃ pyatha;
analyzed: santānaḥ devarukkhe ca vuttaḥ santatiyam
translated: The stream is in the divine tree, and also in the continuity,

original: Uttaraviparīte ca, seṭṭhe cā’nuttaraṃ tisu.
analyzed: uttara viparīte ca seṭṭhe ca anuttaram tisu
translated: And in the superior and the opposite, the unsurpassed is in the three.

original: Sattisampattiyaṃ vutto, kantimatte ca vikkamo;🔽Chāyā tu ātapābhāve, paṭibimbe pabhāya ca.
analyzed: satti sampattiyam vuttaḥ kanti matte ca vikkamaḥ  chāyā tu ātapa abhāve paṭibimbe ca
translated: It is said in the perfection, and in the mere beauty, the difference,🔽But the shadow is in the light and the radiance, in the reflection, and in the radiance.

original: Gimhe ghammo nidāgho ca, uṇhe sedajale pyatha;
analyzed: gimhe ghammaḥ nidāghaḥ ca uṇhe sedajale
translated: In the summer, the rain, the heat, and the heat, the sweat and the water are in the hot,

original: Kappanaṃ kantane vuttaṃ, vikappe sajjane’tthiyaṃ.
analyzed: kappanam kantane vuttam vikappe sajjana itthiyam
translated: The cutting is said in the cutting, in the change, in the people, in the man.

original: Aṅgā dese bahumha’ṅgaṃ, aṅgo dese vapumha’ṅga (ṭī.) tathā’vayavahetusu;
analyzed: aṅgaḥ dese tathā avayava hetusu
translated: In the limbs, in the country, the many limbs, the limb is in the body, in the same way, in the cause of the parts,

original: Devālaye ca thūpasmiṃ, cetiyaṃ cetiya’ddume.
analyzed: devālaye ca thūpasmin cetiyam cetiya dume
translated: And in the temple, in the shrine, the shrine is in the shrine, in the tree.

original: Sajjano sādhupurise, sajjanaṃ kappane pyatha;
analyzed: sajjanaḥ sādhupurise sajjanam kappane
translated: The good man, the good person, the good man, and also in the verse;

original: Supinaṃ supine sutta, viññāṇe ta manitthiyaṃ.
analyzed: supinam supine sutta viññāṇe ta manitthiyam
translated: In a dream, in a dream, in a thread, in consciousness, that is the meaning.

original: Paccakkhe sannidhāne ca, sannidhi parikittito;
analyzed: paccakkhe sannidhāne ca sannidhi parikittito
translated: In the presence of, in the vicinity, and in the vicinity, it is designated;

original: Bhiyyo bahutaratthe so, punaratthe’byayaṃ bhave.
analyzed: bhiyyaḥ bahutaratthe bhave
translated: In the country, in the country, in the country, again, it becomes by.

original: Visalittasare diddho, diddho litte tiliṅgiko;
analyzed: visa litta sare diddhaḥ diddhaḥ litte tiliṅgikaḥ
translated: In the extensive lake, deluded, deluded, in the scattered, it is trilingual;

original: Vāse dhūmādisaṅkhāre, dhivāso sampaṭicchane.
analyzed: vāse dhūma ādi saṅkhāre dhivāsaḥ sampaṭicchane
translated: In the dwelling, in the smoke, etc., formations, the dwelling day, in the acceptance.

original: Vutto visārado tīsu, suppagabbhe ca paṇḍite;
analyzed: vuttaḥ visāra daḥ tīsu suppagabbhe ca paṇḍite
translated: Spoken, confident, in the three, and also in the well-born, the wise;

original: Atha sitthaṃ madhucchiṭṭhe, vuttaṃ odanasambhave.
analyzed: atha sittham madhucchiṭṭhe vuttam odana sambhave
translated: Then the sugar, in the honey, in the sugar-cane, it is said, in the origination of rice.

original: Drave vaṇṇe rasabhede, kasāyo surabhimhi ca;
analyzed: drave vaṇṇe rasabhede kasāyo surabhimhi ca
translated: In the liquid, in the color, in the distinction of taste, in the astringent, and also in the fragrant;

original: Atho uggamanaṃ vuttaṃ, uppattu’ddhagatīsu ca.
analyzed: atho uggamanam vuttam uppattuddha gatīsu ca
translated: And the rising is said, in the origination, and also in the going forth, in the going.

original: Lūkhe niṭṭhuravācāyaṃ, pharusaṃ vāccaliṅgikaṃ;
analyzed: lūkhe niṭṭhura vācāyam pharusam vāccaliṅgikam
translated: In the rough, in the harsh speech, in the harsh, in the speech, it is trilingual;

original: Pavāho tva’mbuvege ca, sandissati pavattiyaṃ.
analyzed: pavāhaḥ tu ambu vege ca sandissati pavattiyam
translated: In the current, and also in the water current, it appears in the occurrence.

original: Nissaye tappare iṭṭhe, parāyaṇapadaṃ tisu;
analyzed: nissaye tad pare iṭṭhe parāyaṇa padam tisu
translated: In the condition, in the superior, in the desirable, the state of refuge, in the three;

original: Kavace vāravāṇe ca, nimmokepi ca kañcuko.
analyzed: kavace vāra vāṇe ca nimmoke api ca kañcukaḥ
translated: In the armor, and also in the battle, and also in the cloud, the coat of mail.

original: Lohabhede mataṃ tambaṃ, tambo ratte tiliṅgiko;
translated: In the distinction of metal, copper, copper, in the red, it is trilingual;

original: Tīsu tva’vasitaṃ ñāte, avasānagate mataṃ.
analyzed: tīsu tu avasitam ñāte avasāna gate matam
translated: In the three, the end is known, the end is reached, the end is gone to.

original: Bodhane ca padāne ca, viññeyyaṃ paṭipādanaṃ;
analyzed: bodhane ca padāne ca viññeyyam paṭipādanam
translated: In the awakening and in the giving, the return should be known;

original: Sele nijjaladese ca, devatāsu marū’rito.
analyzed: ca devatāsu
translated: In the rock, in the place of the waterfall, among the deities, the one called Marut.

original: Satthaṃ āyudha ganthesu, lohe, sattho ca sañcaye;🔽Jīvikāyaṃ vivaraṇe, vattane vutti nāriyaṃ.
analyzed: sattham āyudha ganthesu lohe satthaḥ ca sañcaye  vivaraṇe vattane vutti
translated: In the weapon, in the collection of weapons, in the metal, the weapon and the collection;🔽In the livelihood, in the explanation, in the conduct, the conduct is the feminine.

original: Vīriye sūrabhāve ca, kathīyati parakkamo;
analyzed: vīriye sūrabhāve ca kathīyati parakkamaḥ
translated: In the energy, in the state of being fragrant, the exertion is spoken of;

original: Atha kambu mato saṅkhe, suvaṇṇe valayepi ca.
analyzed: atha saṅkhe suvaṇṇe ca
translated: Then in the conch, the dead body is thought of, in the gold, in the bracelet.

original: Saro kaṇḍe akārādo, sadde vāpimhi’nitthiyaṃ;🔽Dupphasse tikhiṇe tīsu, gadrabhe kakace kharo.
analyzed: sa raḥ kaṇḍe akāra ādaḥ sadde vā api mhinitthiyam  dupphasse ti khiṇe tīsu ga drabhe ka kace kharaḥ
translated: In the arrow, in the neck, in the vowels, in the sound, in the water, the feminine;🔽In the bad sound, in the sharp, in the three, in the ass, in the skin, the rough.

original: Surāyu’paddave kāmā, savādimhi ca āsavo;
analyzed: surā āyu paddave kāmā sava ādimhi ca āsavo
translated: In the liquor, in the flood, in the desires, in the one with a view, the taint;

original: Dehe vutto rathaṅge ca, caturo’padhisū’padhi.
analyzed: dehe vuttaḥ rathaṅge ca catura upadhi sūpadhi
translated: In the body, it is said, and in the chariot part, the four attachments are the attachment.

original: Vatthu’ttaṃ kāraṇe dabbe, bhūbhede ratanattaye;
analyzed: vatthuttam kāraṇe dabbe bhū bhede rata nattaye
translated: In the basis, in the best, in the stick, in the division of the earth, in the three jewels;

original: Yakkho deve mahārāje, kuverā’nucare nare.
analyzed: yakkhaḥ deve mahā rāje kuvera anucare nare
translated: In the yakkha, in the gods, in the great king, in the one who follows Kuvera, in the man.

original: Dārukkhandhe pīṭhikāyaṃ, āpaṇe pīṭha māsane;
analyzed: dārukkhandhe pīṭhikāyam āpaṇe
translated: In the log of wood, in the bench, in the shop, in the seat, in the seat;

original: Parivāre parikkhāro, sambhāre ca vibhūsane.
analyzed: parivāre parikkhāro sambhāre ca vibhūsane
translated: In the retinue, the equipment, in the collection, in the adornment.

original: Vohārasmiñca ṭhapane, paññatti’tthī pakāsane;
analyzed: vohārasmin ca ṭhapane paññattitthī pakāsane
translated: And in the expression ‘to be placed’, ‘paññatti’ is taught in the sense of ‘to be revealed’.

original: Paṭibhānaṃ tu paññāyaṃ, upaṭṭhita girāya ca.
analyzed: paṭibhānam tu paññāyam upaṭṭhita girāya ca
translated: But in the sense of ‘to be understood by wisdom’, and in the sense of ‘to be established by speech’, ‘paṭibhāna’.

original: Vacanāvayave mūle, kathito hetu kāraṇe;
analyzed: vacana avayave mūle kathitaḥ hetu kāraṇe
translated: In the sense of ‘part of speech’, ‘mūla’ is taught in the sense of ‘root’, and in the sense of ‘cause’.

original: Udare tu tathā pācā, nalasmiṃ gahaṇī’tthiyaṃ.
analyzed: udare tu tathā pācā nalasmin
translated: In the sense of ‘stomach’, ‘pācā’ is taught, and in the sense of ‘to be grasped in the hand’, ‘nala’.

original: Piyo bhattari, jāyāyaṃ, piyā, iṭṭhe piyo tisu;
analyzed: piyaḥ bhattari jāyāyam piyaḥ iṭṭhe piyaḥ tisu
translated: In the sense of ‘dear to the husband’, ‘jāyā’ is taught, and in the sense of ‘dear’, ‘piyā’ is taught in the three (genders).

original: Yamarāje tu yugaḷe, saṃyame ca yamo bhave.
analyzed: yamarāje tu yugaḷe saṃyame ca yamaḥ bhave
translated: But in the sense of ‘pair’, ‘yugala’ is taught in the Yamarāja (heaven), and in the sense of ‘restraint’, ‘yamo’.

original: Muddikassa ca pupphassa, rase khudde madhū’ritaṃ;
analyzed: muddikassa ca pupphassa rase khudde madhūritam
translated: And in the sense of ‘flower of the muddika tree’, ‘madhu’ is taught in the sense of ‘sweet taste’.

original: Ulloce tu ca vitthāre, vitānaṃ punnapuṃsake.
analyzed: ulloce tu ca vitthāre vitānam punnapuṃsake
translated: But in the sense of ‘to be extended’, ‘vitthāra’ is taught, and in the sense of ‘full of men’, ‘vitāna’.

original: Apavagge ca salile, sudhāyaṃ amataṃ mataṃ;
analyzed: apavagge ca salile amatam matam
translated: And in the sense of ‘water in a low-lying place’, ‘sudhā’ is taught in the sense of ‘ambrosia’.

original: Mohe tu timire saṅkhyā, guṇe tama manitthiyaṃ.🔽Khare cā’kāriye tīsu, rasamhi purise kaṭu;🔽Paṇḍake sukate, puññaṃ, manuññe pavane tisu.
analyzed: mohe tu timire saṅkhyā guṇe tama  khare cākāriye tīsu rasamhi purise kaṭu  paṇḍake su kate puññam manuññe pavane tisu
translated: But in the sense of ‘delusion’, ‘timira’ is taught in the sense of ‘number’, and in the sense of ‘quality’, ‘tama’ is taught in the sense of ‘man’.🔽In the sense of ‘rough’, ‘kaṭu’ is taught in the three (genders), in the sense of ‘taste’, and in the sense of ‘man’.🔽In the sense of ‘eunuch’, ‘puñña’ is taught, and in the sense of ‘pleasant’, ‘pavaṇa’ is taught in the three (genders).

original: Rukkho dumamhi, pharusā, siniddhesu ca so tisu;
analyzed: rukkhaḥ dumamhi pharusā siniddhesu ca saḥ tisu
translated: In the sense of ‘tree’, ‘duma’ is taught in the sense of ‘rough’, and in the sense of ‘smooth’, ‘so’ is taught in the three (genders).

original: Uppattiyaṃ tu hetumhi, saṅge sukke ca sambhavo.
analyzed: uppattiyam tu hetumhi saṅge sukke ca sambhavaḥ
translated: But in the sense of ‘arising’, ‘saṅga’ is taught in the sense of ‘cause’, and in the sense of ‘white’, ‘sambhava’.

original: Nimittaṃ kāraṇe vuttaṃ, aṅgajāte ca lañchane;
analyzed: nimittam kāraṇe vuttam aṅga jāte ca lañchane
translated: ‘Nimitta’ is taught in the sense of ‘cause’, and in the sense of ‘mark’, ‘aṅga

original: Ādi sīmāpakāresu, samīpe’vayave mato.
analyzed: ādi sīmā apakāresu samīpa ivayave mato
translated: The beginning, a boundary, a transgression, near, a part, and dead.

original: Vede ca mantane manto, mantā paññāya muccate;
analyzed: vede ca mantane mantaḥ mantā paññāya muccate
translated: And a Veda, and a mantra, a mantra, a mantra is released by wisdom;

original: Anayo byasane ceva, sandissati vipattiyaṃ.
analyzed: anayaḥ byasane ca iva sandissati vipattiyam
translated: And a means, and a calamity, and it will appear in a disaster.

original: Aruṇo raṃsibhede cā, byattarāge ca lohite;
analyzed: aruṇaḥ raṃsi bhede ca ā byatta rāge ca lohite
translated: Dawn, and a difference in rays, and in red, and in a good passion;

original: Anubandho tu pakatā, nivatte nassanakkhare.
analyzed: anubandhaḥ tu pakatā nivatte nassa nakkhare
translated: But a consequence, and a natural state, and a fault that is disappearing.

original: Avatāro’vataraṇe, titthamhi vivare pyatha;
analyzed: avatāra uvataraṇe vivare
translated: A descent, and a descent, and a ford, and a hole, and then;

original: Ākāro kāraṇe vutto, saṇṭhāne iṅgitepi ca.
analyzed: ākāraḥ kāraṇe vuttaḥ saṇṭhāne iṅgite pi ca
translated: A form, and a reason, and a shape, and a gesture, and also.

original: Sudditthi tanaye khattā, uggo, tibbamhi so tisu;
analyzed: tanaye khattā uggaḥ tibbamhi saḥ tisu
translated: A good view, and a son, and a wise man, and a hump, and sharp, and in three;

original: Padhānaṃ tu mahāmatte, pakatya’gga’dhitīsu ca.
analyzed: padhānam tu mahā matte ca
translated: And an exertion, and in a great man, and in a natural state, and in the head, and in the mind.

original: Kallaṃ pabhāte, niroga, sajjadakkhesu yuttadakkhesu (ka.) tīsu taṃ;
analyzed: kallam pabhāte sajja dakkhesu yutta dakkhesu ka tīsu tam
translated: Good, and in the morning, and healthy, and in a well-equipped balance, and in three well-equipped balances;

original: Kuhanā kūṭacariyāyaṃ, kuhano kuhake tisu.
analyzed: kuhanā kūṭa cariyā ayam kuhanā kuhake tisu
translated: Deceit, and in crooked conduct, and a deceiver, and in a deceiver, and in three.

original: Kapoto pakkhibhede ca, diṭṭho pārāvate tha ca;🔽Sārado sāradabbhūte, apagabbhe mato tisu.
analyzed: kapotaḥ pakkhibhede ca diṭṭhaḥ pārāvate ca  sāradaḥ apagabbhe mataḥ tisu
translated: A dove, and in a difference of birds, and seen, and in a Pāvāla tree, and in a place;🔽Firm, and in a firm deer, and in one without a womb, and dead in three.

original: Tīsu khare ca kaṭhine, kakkaso sāhasappiye sāhasappiye=sāhasa+appiye (ṭī.);
analyzed: tīsu khare ca kaṭhine kakkasaḥ sāhasappiye sāhasappiye sāhasaappiye ṭī
translated: In three, and in a hard place, and a hard-hearted man, and in a cruel man, and in a cruel man=cruel+man (commentary);

original: Akāriye tu guyhaṅge, cīre kopīna muccate.
analyzed: akāriye tu cīre muccate
translated: But in the case of what is not to be done, in the private parts, the skin is torn.

original: Migabhede paṭākāyaṃ, moce ca kadalī’tthiyaṃ;
analyzed: migabhede paṭākāyam moce ca kadalītthiyam
translated: In the case of the deer-mark, in the banner, and in the plantain-trunk, it is released.

original: Dakkhiṇā dānabhedasmiṃ, vāmato’ññamhi dakkhiṇo.
analyzed: dakkhiṇā dāna bhedasmiṃ dakkhiṇaḥ
translated: In the case of the gift, in the case of the division of gifts, on the right, on the left, and on the other side, it is right.

original: Dutiyā bhariyāyañca, dvinnaṃ pūraṇiyaṃ matā;
analyzed: dutiyā bhariyāyan ca dvinnam pūraṇiyam matā
translated: In the case of the second, in the case of the wife, and in the case of the two, it is considered to be Pūraṇa.

original: Athuppāde siyā dhūma, ketu vessānarepi ca.
analyzed: athuppāde siyā dhūma ketu vessānarepi ca
translated: In the case of the foot, there may be smoke, and in the case of the banner, and in the case of the Vessānaras, there is a banner.

original: Bhavaniggamane yāne, dvāre nissaraṇaṃ siyā;
analyzed: bhava niggamane yāne dvāre nissaraṇam siyā
translated: In the case of the departure from existence, in the case of the vehicle, at the door, there may be departure.

original: Niyāmako potavāhe, tiliṅgo so niyantari.🔽Apavagge vināse ca, nirodho rodhane pyatha;
analyzed: niyāmakaḥ pota vāhe ti liṅgaḥ saḥ niyantari  apavagge vināse ca nirodhaḥ rodhane
translated: In the case of the one who determines, in the case of the vehicle, the one who determines is of three genders.🔽In the case of the section, in the case of the destruction, in the case of the cessation, in the case of the restraint, there is cessation.

original: Bhaye paṭibhayaṃ vuttaṃ, tiliṅgaṃ taṃ bhayaṃkare.
analyzed: bhaye paṭibhayam vuttam tiliṅgam tam bhayaṃkare
translated: In the case of fear, the opposite is said, and that fear is of three genders.

original: Piṭakaṃ bhājane vuttaṃ, tatheva pariyattiyaṃ;
analyzed: piṭakam bhājane vuttam tathā iva pariyattiyam
translated: In the case of the basket, it is said in the case of the vessel, and in the same way in the case of the doctrine.

original: Jarāsithilacammasmiṃ, udaraṅge matā vali.🔽Bhinnaṃ vidārite’ññasmiṃ, nissite vāccaliṅgikaṃ;
analyzed: udaraṅge matā  bhinnam vidārita iññasmin nissite vāccaliṅgikam
translated: In the case of the old man, in the case of the loose skin, in the case of the belly, it is considered to be a line.🔽In the case of the broken, in the case of the torn, in the case of the other, in the case of the fixed, it is of three genders.

original: Upajāpe mato bhedo, visese ca vidāraṇe.
analyzed: upajāpe mataḥ bhedaḥ visese ca vidāraṇe
translated: In the case of the division, it is considered to be the division, in the case of the distinction, in the case of the tearing.

original: Maṇḍalaṃ gāmasandohe, bimbe paridhirāsisu;
analyzed: maṇḍalam gāma sandohe bimbe paridhi rāsisu
translated: In the case of the circle, in the case of the village, in the case of the mark, in the case of the heap of sticks,

original: Āṇāya māgame lekhe; Sāsanaṃ anusāsane.
analyzed: lekhe sāsanam anusāsane
translated: in the case of the order, in the case of the Māgaṇḍiya letter, in the case of the teaching, in the case of the instruction.

original: Agge tu sikharaṃ cā’yo, mayavijjhanakaṇṭake;
analyzed: agge tu sikharam ca ayaḥ maya vijjhana kaṇṭake
translated: The top, the peak, the iron, the Mayas, the piercing, the thorn,

original: Guṇukkaṃse ca vibhave, sampatti ceva sampadā.
analyzed: ca vibhave ca iva sampadā
translated: The Guṇukka, the basket, the wealth, the prosperity, and the accomplishment.

original: Bhūkhantīsu khamā, yogye, hite sakke yutte (ṭī.) 1001-gāthā passitabbā khamo tisu;
analyzed: bhū khantīsu khamā yogye hite sakke yutte ṭī passitabbā khamaḥ tisu
translated: In the hungry, the forbearance, the suitable, the beneficial, the able, the proper (in the commentary) – the verse should be seen in the three: the forbearing.

original: Addho bhāge pathe kāle, ekaṃse’ddho’byayaṃ bhave;
analyzed: addhas bhāge pathe kāle ekaṃsa id dhas byayam bhave
translated: The back, the part, the path, the time, the one-sided, the back, the imperishable, the existence;

original: Atho karīsaṃ vaccasmiṃ, vuccate caturambaṇe.
analyzed: atho karīsam vaccasmin vuccate catur ambaṇe
translated: And the dung, in the cow, is said in the four-cornered (in the commentary).

original: Usabho’sadha go usabho usabhe (ṭī.) seṭṭhe, sū’sabhaṃ vīsayaṭṭhiyaṃ;🔽Setusmiṃ tanti pantīsu, nāriyaṃ pāḷi kathyate.
analyzed: usabha usadha go usabhaḥ usabhe seṭṭhe sūsabham  setusmin tanti pantīsu nāriyam pāḷi kathyate
translated: The bull, the base, the cow, the bull, the bull (in the commentary) in the best, the assembly, the twenty-first;🔽In the bridge, the thread, in the paths, the female is said in the recitation.

original: Kaṭo jaye’tthinimitte, kilañje so kate tisu;
analyzed: kaṭaḥ kilañje saḥ kate tisu
translated: The buttocks, the victory, in the sign of wealth, the burden, that made in the three;

original: Mahiyaṃ jagatī vuttā, mandirālindavatthumhi.
analyzed: mahiyam jagatī vuttā mandira alinda vatthumhi
translated: In the great, the world is said, in the temple, the story of the garland.

original: Vitakke mathite takko, tathā sūciphale mato;
analyzed: vitakke mathite takko tathā sūciphale mataḥ
translated: In the thoughts, the thought is crushed, the thought is likewise crushed in the needle-fruit;

original: Sudassanaṃ sakkapure, tīsu taṃ duddase’tare.
analyzed: sudassanam sakka pure tīsu tam duddasa itare
translated: The good view, in the city of Sakka, that is the fifteenth, the other, in the three.

original: Dīpo’ntarīpa pajjota, patiṭṭhā nibbutīsu ca;
analyzed: dīpa untarīpa pajjota patiṭṭhā nibbutīsu ca
translated: The island, the continent, the light, the support, in the three extinguished;

original: Baddhanissita setesu, tīsu taṃ mihite sitaṃ.
analyzed: baddha nissita sa itesu tīsu tam mi hite sitam
translated: In the bound, the dependent, in the bridges, the white is aimed at in the three.

original: Thiyaṃ pajāpati dāre, brahme māre sure pume;
analyzed: thiyam pajāpati dāre brahme māre sure pume
translated: In the wife, the people, the wife, in the Brahman, the Māra, the gods, the men;

original: Vāsudeve’ntake kaṇho, so pāpe asite tisu.
analyzed: vāsudeva intake kaṇhaḥ saḥ pāpe asite tisu
translated: In Vāsudeva, in the end, black, that, in evil, in poison, in three.

original: Upacāro upaṭṭhāne, āsanne aññaropane;
analyzed: upacāraḥ upaṭṭhāne āsanne añña ropane
translated: Service, in attendance, near, in planting another,

original: Sakko inde janapade, sākiye, so khame tisu.
analyzed: sakkaḥ inde janapade sākiye saḥ khame tisu
translated: In Sakka, in the chief, in the country, in the Sākiyas, that, in forgiveness, in three.

original: Vajjane parihāro ca, sakkāre ceva rakkhaṇe;
analyzed: vajjane parihāro ca sakkāre ca iva rakkhaṇe
translated: In the people, in the rejection, in the honouring, in the protection,

original: Sotāpannādike agge, ariyo tīsu, dvije pume.
analyzed: sotāpanna ādike agge ariyaḥ tīsu dvije pume
translated: In the stream-enterer, etc., in the chief, in the noble, in three, in the twice-born, in the man.

original: Susuko susumāre ca, bālake ca ulūpini;
analyzed: susuko susumāre ca bālake ca ulūpini
translated: In the good, in the good-looking, and in the child, in the owl, in the female,

original: Indīvaraṃ mataṃ nīlu, ppale uddālapādape.
analyzed: indīvaram matam uddāla pādape
translated: The blue lotus, the dead body, the blue, in the dew, in the Uddālapāda tree.

original: Asano piyake kaṇḍe, bhakkhaṇe khipane’ sanaṃ;
analyzed: asanaḥ piyake kaṇḍe bhakkhaṇe khipane sanam
translated: The seat, in the beloved, in the shoulder, in the eating, in the throwing, in the eating of the food,

original: Yuge’dhikāre vikāre (ṭī.) vīriye, padhāne cā’ntike dhuro.
analyzed: yuga idhikāre vikāre vīriye padhāne ca antike
translated: In the yoke, in the authority, in the change (of voice), in the energy, in the endeavour, in the near, in the strong.

original: Kāḷe ca bhakkhite tīsu, lavitte asito pume;
analyzed: kāḷe ca bhakkhite tīsu lavitte asitaḥ pume
translated: In the black, in the eaten, in the three, in the shaken, in the poison, in the man,

original: Pavāraṇā paṭikkhepe, kathitā’jjhesanāya ca.
analyzed: pavāraṇā paṭikkhepe kathitā ajjhesanāya ca
translated: In the invitation, in the rejection, it is said, in the request.

original: Ummāre esikatthambhe, indakhīlo mato tha ca;
analyzed: ummāre esikatthambhe indakhīlaḥ mataḥ tha ca
translated: In the woman, in the post of the yoke, in the Indra-peg, in the dead body, in the tree,

original: Potthakaṃ makacivatthe, ganthe lepyādi kammani.
analyzed: potthakam maka civatthe ganthe lepya ādi kammani
translated: In the cloth, in the bark-cloth, in the bundle, in the pasting, etc., work.

original: Dhaññaṃ sālyādike vuttaṃ, dhañño puññavati ttisu;
analyzed: dhaññam sāli ādike vuttam dhaññaḥ puññavati ttisu
translated: Grain, in the rice, etc., is said, grain, in the virtuous, in three,

original: Pāṇi hatthe ca satte bhū, saṇhakaraṇiyaṃ mato.
analyzed: pāṇi hatthe ca satte bhū saṇhakaraṇiyam mato
translated: The hand, in the hand, and in the beings, in the earth, is considered as the solid.

original: Tīsu pītaṃ halidyābhe, haṭṭhe ca pāyite siyā;🔽Byūho nibbiddharacchāyaṃ, balanyāse gaṇe mato.
analyzed: tīsu pītam halidya ābhe haṭṭhe ca pāyite siyā  byūhaḥ balanyāse gaṇe
translated: In the three (kinds of) yellow, yellow-dye, and in a yellow-robe, it may be said;🔽In a crowd, in disgust, in a shadow, in a (place of) strength, in a (place of) exertion, in a group, it is considered.

original: Lohitādimhi lobhe ca, rāgo ca rañjane mato;🔽Padaro phalake bhaṅge, pavuddha dariyaṃ pica.
analyzed: lohita ādimhi lobhe ca rāgaḥ ca rañjane mato  padaraḥ phalake bhaṅge dariyam pica
translated: In blood, etc., in greed, and in passion, it is considered in the dyeing of cloth;🔽In a slab, in a fracture, in a (place of) overflow, in a wild animal, in a (place of) fat.

original: Siṅghāṭakaṃ kaserussa, phale, maggasamāgame;
analyzed: siṅghāṭakam kaserussa phale magga samāgame
translated: In a cross-road, in a (place of) poison, in a fruit, in a meeting of roads,

original: Bahulāyañca kheḷamhi, eḷā, dose’ḷa mīritaṃ.🔽Ādhāro cā’dhikaraṇe, pattādhāre’ lavālake;
analyzed: eḷā doseḷa mīritam  ādhāraḥ ca adhikaraṇe patta ādhāre lavālake
translated: In a (place of) abundance, in spittle, in a goat, in a (place of) poison, in a dead goat.🔽In a support, in a reason, in a bowl-support, in a (place of) overflow,

original: Kāro’ gabhede sakkāre, kārā tu bandhanālaye.🔽Karakā meghapāsāṇe, karako kuṇḍikāya ca;
analyzed: kāraḥ gabhede sakkāre kārā tu bandhanālaye  karakā meghapāsāṇe karako kuṇḍikāya ca
translated: In a (place of) cutting, in a (place of) honour, in a (place of) cutting, but in a prison,🔽In a water-pot, in a cloud, in a stone, in a water-pot, and in a water-pot,

original: Pāpane ca padātismiṃ, gamane patti nāriyaṃ.🔽Chiddaṃ randhañca vivaraṃ, susire dūsanepi ca;
analyzed: pāpane ca padātismim gamane  chiddam randham ca vivaram susire ca
translated: In a snake, in a foot, in going, in a (place of) running, in a (place of) running.🔽In a hole, in a gap, in an opening, in a hollow, and in a fault,

original: Muttā tu muttike, muttaṃ, passāve, muccite tisu.
analyzed: muttā tu muttike muttam passāve muccite tisu
translated: In a pearl, in a pearl-string, in urine, in a (place of) urine, in the three (places of) urine.

original: Nisedhe vāraṇaṃ, hatthi, liṅga hatthīsu vāraṇo;
analyzed: nisedhe vāraṇam hatthi liṅga hatthīsu vāraṇaḥ
translated: In a prohibition, in an elephant, in a sign, in elephants, a prohibition;

original: Dānaṃ cāge made suddhe, khaṇḍane lavane khaye.
analyzed: dānam ca āge made suddhe khaṇḍane lavane khaye
translated: In a gift, in a letting go, in a pure (state), in a breaking, in a burning, in a destruction.

original: Manotose ca nibbāne, tthaṅgame nibbuti’tthiyaṃ;
analyzed: manotose ca nibbāne tthaṅgame nibbutitthiyam
translated: In a mind-made (body), in Nibbāna, in a disappearance, in Nibbāna, in a (place of) disappearance.

original: Negamo nigamubbhūte, tathā’paṇopajīvini.
analyzed: negamaḥ nigama ubbhūte tathā āpaṇa upajīvini
translated: Negamo is a village, and Nigamubbhūte, and likewise in the sense of ‘living by a town.’

original: Haritasmiñca paṇṇe ca, palāso kiṃ sukaddume;
analyzed: haritasmin ca paṇṇe ca palāsaḥ kim su kaddume
translated: Haritasmiñca paṇṇe ca, Palāso kiṃ sukaddume;

original: Pakāso pākaṭetīsu, ālokasmiṃ pume mato.
analyzed: pakāsaḥ ālokasmim pume mato
translated: Pakāso pākaṭetīsu, Ālokasmiṃ pume mato.

original: Pakkaṃ phalamhi, taṃ nāsu, mmukhe nāsamukhe (ka.) pariṇate tisu;
analyzed: pakkam phalamhi tam pariṇate tisu
translated: Pakkaṃ phalamhi, taṃ nāsu, Mmuke nāsamukhe (ka.) pariṇate tisu;

original: Piṇḍo ājīvane dehe, piṇḍane goḷake mato.
analyzed: ājīvane dehe piṇḍane goḷake mataḥ
translated: Piṇḍo ājīvane dehe, Piṇḍane goḷake mato.

original: Vaṭṭo paribbaye kammā, dike, so vaṭṭule tisu;
analyzed: vaṭṭaḥ paribbaye kammā dike saḥ vaṭṭule tisu
translated: Vaṭṭo paribbaye kammā, Dike, so vaṭṭule tisu;

original: Paccāhāre paṭihāro, dvāre ca dvārapālake.
analyzed: paccāhāre paṭihāraḥ dvāre ca dvārapālake
translated: Paccāhāre paṭihāro, Dvāre ca dvārapālake.

original: Nāriyaṃ bhīru kathitā, bhīruke so tiliṅgiko;
analyzed: nāriyam bhīru kathitā bhīruke saḥ tiliṅgikaḥ
translated: Nāriyaṃ bhīru kathitā, Bhīruke so tiliṅgiko;

original: Vikaṭaṃ gūthamuttādo, vikaṭo vikate tisu.
analyzed: vikaṭam gūtham uttādaḥ vikaṭaḥ vikate tisu
translated: Vikaṭaṃ gūthamuttādo, Vikaṭo vikate tisu.

original: Vāmaṃ sabyamhi, taṃ cāru, viparītesu tīsva’tha;
analyzed: vāmam tam cāru viparītesu tīsu atha
translated: Vāmaṃ sabyamhi, taṃ cāru, Viparītesu tīsva’tha;

original: Saṅkhyābhede sarabye ca, cihaṇe lakkha muccate.
analyzed: saṅkhyā bhede sarabye ca cihaṇe muccate
translated: Saṅkhyābhede sarabye ca, Cihaṇe lakkha muccate.

original: Seṇī’tthī samasippīnaṃ, gaṇe cā’valiyaṃ pica;
analyzed: seṇītthī gaṇe ca āvaliyam pica
translated: Seṇī’tthī samasippīnaṃ, Gaṇe cā’valiyaṃ pica;

original: Sudhāyaṃ dhūliyaṃ cuṇṇo, cuṇṇañca vāsacuṇṇake.
analyzed: sudhāyam dhūliyam cuṇṇaḥ cuṇṇam ca vāsacuṇṇake
translated: Sudhāyaṃ dhūliyaṃ cuṇṇo, Cuṇṇañca vāsacuṇṇake.

original: Jetabbe’tippasatthe’ti, vuddhe jeyyaṃ tisū’ritaṃ;
analyzed: jetabbā itippasatthā iti vuddhe jeyyam tisūritam
translated: Jetabbe’tippasatthe’ti, Vuddhe jeyyaṃ tisū’ritaṃ;

original: Takke tu mathitaṃ hotyā,
analyzed: takke tu mathitam hotyā
translated: Takke tu mathitaṃ hotyā,

original: Lolite mathito tisu.
analyzed: lolite mathitaḥ tisu
translated: Lolite mathito tisu.

original: Abbhuto’cchariye tīsu, paṇe cevā’bbhuto pume;
analyzed: abbhuta ucchariye tīsu paṇe ca iva abbhutaḥ pume
translated: The words abbhuta and acchariya are used in the three genders,

original: Mecako pucchamūlamhi, kaṇhepi mecako tisu.🔽Vasavattī pume māre, vasavattāpake tisu;
analyzed: mecako puccha mūlamhi kaṇhe pi mecako tisu  vasavattī pume māre vasavattā apake tisu
translated: The words mecaka and kaṇha are used in the three genders,🔽The words vasavattī and vasavattā are used in the three genders,

original: Sambhave cā’suci pume, amejjhe tīsu dissati.
analyzed: sambhave ca asuci pume am ejjhe tīsu dissati
translated: The words sambhava and asuci are used in the three genders,

original: Accho ikke pume vutto, pasannamhi tiliṅgiko;
analyzed: acchaḥ ikke pume vuttaḥ pasannamhi tiliṅgikaḥ
translated: The words accho and ikke are used in the three genders,

original: Baḷise selabhede ca, vaṅko, so kuṭile tisu.
analyzed: baḷise selabhede ca vaṅko saḥ kuṭile tisu
translated: The words baḷisa and sela are used in the three genders,

original: Kuṇapamhi chavo ñeyyo,
analyzed: kuṇapamhi chavaḥ ñeyyaḥ
translated: The words kuṇapa and chava are used in the three genders,

original: Lāmake so tiliṅgiko;
analyzed: lāmake saḥ tiliṅgikaḥ
translated: The words lāmaka and so are used in the three genders,

original: Sabbasmiṃ sakalo tīsu, addhamhi purise siyā.🔽Candaggāhādike cevu, ppādo uppattiyaṃ pica;
analyzed: sabbasmin sakalaḥ tīsu addhamhi purise siyā  canda ggāha ādike uppattiyam pica
translated: The words sakala and sabba are used in the three genders,🔽The words ppādo and uppatti are used in the three genders,

original: Padussane padoso ca, kathito saṃvarīmukhe.🔽Rudhire lohitaṃ vuttaṃ, rattamhi lohito tisu;
analyzed: padussane padosaḥ ca kathitaḥ saṃvarī mukhe  rudhire lohitam vuttam rattamhi lohitaḥ tisu
translated: The words padussana and padosa are used in the three genders,🔽The words lohita and ruhi are used in the three genders,

original: Uttamaṅge pume muddhā, muddho mūḷhe tiliṅgiko.
analyzed: uttamaṅge pume muddhā muddhaḥ mūḍhe tiliṅgikaḥ
translated: The words muddhā and mūḷha are used in the three genders,

original: Raṭṭhamhi vijitaṃ vuttaṃ, jite ca vijito tisu;
analyzed: raṭṭhamhi vijitam vuttam jite ca vijitaḥ tisu
translated: The words vijita and jita are used in the three genders,

original: Parittaṃ tu parittāṇe, paritto tīsu appake.
analyzed: parittam tu parittāṇe parittaḥ tīsu appake
translated: The words paritta and parittaṇa are used in the three genders,

original: Kumbhaṇḍo devabhede ca, dissati vallijātiyaṃ;
analyzed: kumbhaṇḍaḥ devabhede ca dissati valli jātiyam
translated: The words kumbhaṇḍa and valli are used in the three genders,

original: Catutthaṃse pade pādo, paccantaselaraṃsisu.
analyzed: catuttha ṃse pade pādaḥ
translated: In the fourth case, in the word pādo, and in the words paccantaselaraṃsi.

original: Vaṅgo lohantare vaṅgā, dese pume bahumhi ca;
analyzed: vaṅgaḥ lohantare vaṅgāḥ dese pume bahumhi ca
translated: Vaṅgo is in the word lohantare vaṅgā, and in the words dese pume bahumhi ca;

original: Kammārabhaṇḍabhede ca, khaṭake muṭṭhi ca dvisu.
analyzed: kammārabhaṇḍa bhede ca khaṭake muṭṭhi ca dvisu
translated: Kamma is in the words kammārabhaṇḍabhede ca, and khaṭaka is in the words muṭṭhi ca dvisu.

original: Ambaṇaṃ doṇiyaṃ ce’kā, dasadoṇappamāṇake;
analyzed: ambaṇam doṇiyam ca ikā dasa doṇa ppamāṇake
translated: Ambaṇaṃ is in the words doṇiyaṃ ce’kā, and dasadoṇappamāṇake;

original: Adhiṭṭhitiya mādhāre, ṭhāne’dhiṭṭhāna muccate.
analyzed: adhiṭṭhitiya mādhāre ṭhānedhiṭṭhāna muccate
translated: Adhiṭṭhiti is in the words mādhāre, and ṭhāne’dhiṭṭhāna is in the words muccate.

original: Pume mahesī sugate, deviyaṃ nāriyaṃ matā;
analyzed: pume mahesī sugate deviyam nāriyam matā
translated: Pume is in the words mahesī sugate, and deviyaṃ is in the words nāriyaṃ matā;

original: Upaddave upasaggo, dissati pādikepi ca.
analyzed: upaddave upasaggaḥ dissati pādike pi ca
translated: Upaddava is in the words upasaggo, and dissati is in the words pādikepi ca.

original: Vakkaṃ koṭṭhāsabhedasmiṃ, vakko vaṅke tisu’ccate;
analyzed: vakkam koṭṭhāsa bhedasmin vakkaḥ vaṅke tis uccate
translated: Vakkaṃ is in the words koṭṭhāsabhedasmiṃ, and vakko is in the words vaṅke tisu’ccate;

original: Vijjā vede ca sippe ca, tivijjādo ca buddhiyaṃ.
analyzed: vijjā vede ca sippe ca ca
translated: Vijjā is in the words vede ca sippe ca, and tivijjā is in the words do ca buddhiyaṃ.

original: Samādhimhi pume’kaggo, nākule vāccaliṅgiko;
analyzed: samādhimhi pum ekaggaḥ na a kule vāccaliṅgiko
translated: Samādhi is in the words pume’kaggo, and nākule is in the words vāccaliṅgiko;

original: Pajjaṃ siloke, pajjo’ddhe, pajjo pādahite tisu.
analyzed: pajjam si loke pajjoddhe pajjo pāda hite tisu
translated: Pajjaṃ is in the words siloke, pajjo is in the words’ddhe, and pajjo is in the words pādahite tisu.

original: Katako rukkhabhedasmiṃ, katako kittime tisu;
analyzed: katakaḥ rukkha bhedasmim katakaḥ kittime tisu
translated: Katako is in the words rukkhabhedasmiṃ, and katako is in the words kittime tisu;

original: Vidheyye assavo tīsu, pubbamhī purise siyā.
analyzed: vidheyye assavaḥ tīsu pubbamhi purise siyā
translated: Vidheyya is in the words assavo tīsu, and pubbamhī is in the words purise siyā.

original: Kalyāṇe kathitaṃ khemaṃ, tīsu laddhattharakkhaṇe;
analyzed: kalyāṇe kathitam khemam tīsu laddhattha rakkhaṇe
translated: Kalyāṇa is said in the words kathitaṃ khemaṃ, and in the words tīsu laddhattharakkhaṇe;

original: Atho niyojane vuttaṃ, kāriyepi payojanaṃ.
analyzed: atho niyojane vuttam kāriye api payojanam
translated: Atho is in the words niyojane vuttaṃ, and kāriya is in the words payojanaṃ.

original: Assattho tīsu assāsa, ppatte, bodhiddume pume;
analyzed: tīsu bodhi dume pume
translated: Assattha is a tree, in three places it is a sigh; ppatte, bodhi, and dume are trees.

original: Tīsu luddo kurūre ca, nesādamhi pume siyā.
analyzed: tīsu luddaḥ kurūre ca nesādamhi pume siyā
translated: Ludda is a hunter, in three places it is a deer; kurūra is a deer, in three places it is a man.

original: Vilaggo tīsu laggasmiṃ, pume majjhamhi dissati;
analyzed: vilaggaḥ tīsu laggasmin pume majjhamhi dissati
translated: Vilaggo is a lamp, in three places it is a stick; pume is a man, in the middle it is seen.

original: Aḍḍho tvanitthiyaṃ bhāge, dhanimhi vāccaliṅgiko.
analyzed: bhāge dhanimhi vāccaliṅgikaḥ
translated: Aḍḍha is rich, in the feminine it is a woman; in the neuter it is a word, in the accusative it is a sign.

original: Kaṭṭhaṃ dārumhi, taṃ kicche, gahane kasite tisu;
analyzed: kaṭṭham dārumhi tam kicche gahane kasite tisu
translated: Kaṭṭha is wood, in three places it is a tree; gahana is a forest, in three places it is difficult.

original: Sasantāne ca visaye, gocare’ jjhatta muccateti.
analyzed: sa santāne ca visaye gocare jjhatta muccata iti
translated: Sasantāna is a series, in three places it is a country; gocare is a pasture, in three places it is inside.

original: Iti addhānekatthavaggo.
analyzed: iti addhā aneka attha vaggaḥ
translated: Thus ends the section on many meanings in one word.

original: Bhuvane ca jane loko, moretvaggimhi so sikhī;🔽Siloko tu yase pajje,
analyzed: bhuvane ca jane lokaḥ saḥ sikhī  silokaḥ tu yase pajje
translated: Bhuvana is the world, in three places it is people; loka is the world, in three places it is a flame.🔽Siloka is a verse, in three places it is praise;

original: Rukkhe tu sāmike dhavo.
analyzed: rukkhe tu sāmike dhavaḥ
translated: Rukkha is a tree, in three places it is a lord.

original: Vaṭabyāmesu nigrodho, dhaṅko tu vāyase bake;
analyzed: vaṭa byāmesu nigrodhaḥ dhaṅkaḥ tu vāyase bake
translated: Vaṭa is a banyan tree, in three places it is a bird; nigrodha is a fig tree, in three places it is a bird.

original: Vāro tva’vasarā’hesu, kucetvabbhe payodharo.
analyzed: vāraḥ payodharaḥ
translated: Vāra is a turn, in three places it is an opportunity; kucchi is a belly, in three places it is a cloud.

original: Ucchaṅge lakkhaṇe cā’ṅko, rasmi’tthī juti rajjusu;
analyzed: ucchaṅge lakkhaṇe ca aṅkaḥ rasmitthī juti rajjusu
translated: Ucchaṅga is a hump, in three places it is a mark; aṅka is a line, in three places it is a ray.

original: Diṭṭho’bhāsesu āloko,
analyzed: diṭṭha ubhāsesu āloko
translated: Diṭṭha is seen, in three places it is a light;

original: Buddho tu paṇḍite jine.🔽Sūraṃ’sūsu pume bhānū, daṇḍo tu muggare dame;🔽Devamacchesva’nimiso, pattho tu mānasānusu.
analyzed: buddhaḥ tu paṇḍite jine  pume bhānū daṇḍaḥ tu muggare dame  deva macchesu animisaḥ patthaḥ tu māna sānusu
translated: Buddho is enlightened, in three places it is a wise person.🔽Sūra is a hero, in three places it is a man; bhānu is the sun, in three places it is a ray.🔽Daṇḍa is a staff, in three places it is a punishment; aṇimisa is the eye, in three places it is a god.

original: Ātaṅko roga tāpesu,
analyzed: ātaṅkaḥ roga tāpesu
translated: Pattā is a leaf, in three places it is a boat; ātaṅka is a disease, in three places it is a fever.

original: Mātaṅgo sapace gaje;
analyzed: mātaṅgo sapace gaje
translated: Mātaṅga is a wild elephant,

original: Migo pasu kuruṅgesu, ulūki’ndesu kosiyo.
analyzed: migo pasu kuruṅgesu ulūkindesu kosiyaḥ
translated: Migo is a deer, kuruṅga is an antelope, ulūki is an owl, kosiyo is a peacock.

original: Viggaho kalahe kāye, puriso māṇava’ttasu;
analyzed: viggahaḥ kalahe kāye purisaḥ
translated: Viggaha is a quarrel, kāya is a body, puriso is a man, māṇava is a youth.

original: Dāyādo bandhave putte, sire sīsaṃ tipumhi ca.
analyzed: dāyādaḥ bandhave putte sire sīsam tipumhi ca
translated: Dāyādo is an heir, bandhu is a relative, putto is a son, sire is a father, sīsa is the head, tipumhi is on the ground.

original: Balihatthaṃ’sūsu karo, dante vippe’ṇḍaje dvijo;
analyzed: karaḥ dante vippeṇḍa je dvijaḥ
translated: Balihatthaṃ is a sacrificial offering, dante is in the teeth, vippe is a tusk, dvijo is a twice-born person.

original: Vattaṃ pajjā’nanā’cāre, dhaññaṅge sukhume kaṇo.
analyzed: vattam pajjānana ācāre dhaññaṅge su khume kaṇo
translated: Vatta is a custom, pajjā is a question, ananā is a vow, aṅga is a limb, sukhume is subtle, kaṇo is a grain.

original: Thambho thūṇa jaḷattesu, sūpo kummāsa byañjane;
analyzed: thambhaḥ thūṇa jaḷattesu sūpaḥ kummāsa byañjane
translated: Thambho is a pillar, thūṇa is a post, jaḷattam is stupidity, sūpo is rice, kummāsa is gruel, byañjana is a condiment.

original: Gaṇḍo phoṭe kapolamhi, aggho mūlye ca pūjane.
analyzed: gaṇḍo phoṭe kapolamhi agghaḥ mūlye ca pūjane
translated: Gaṇḍo is a boil, phoṭo is a blow, kapola is a cheek, aggho is a price, pūja is worship.

original: Pakāro tulya bhedesu, sakunto bhāsapakkhisu;
analyzed: pakāraḥ tulya bhedesu sakuntaḥ bhāsa pakkhisu
translated: Pakāro is a kind, tulya is equal, bhedesu is in divisions, sakunto is a bird, bhāsa is a peacock.

original: Bhāgye vidhi vidhāne ca, sare khagge ca sāyako.
analyzed: bhāgye vidhi vidhāne ca sare khagge ca sāyako
translated: Bhāgye is in luck, vidhi is a rule, vidhāne is in performance, sare is an arrow, khagge is a sword, sāyako is a warrior.
